medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began one day prior to admission; patient was in usual health before experiencing sharp abdominal pain that worsened. The pain was non-radiating and associated with non-bloody vomiting and nausea. Patient has not experienced pain like this before. Denies any bowel symptoms, although there is baseline leg swelling due to lymphedema.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cerebral palsy, neurogenic bladder with chronic indwelling catheter, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, gout, large meningioma, recent deep vein thrombosis.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of breast cancer. Father died of throat cancer.
